Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery eye-cup; interior glazed black (mostly worn and chipped surface); exterior: from top, black-figure decoration consisting of male to left (foot and lower leg remaining), in front of uncertain object, perhaps lower leg of male falling(?) to right; dots in field; below, wide added red band between sets of three black lines, above alternate black and outline rays at foot.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a near parallel, see Oxford AN1896-1908-G.1113.
Bibliographic references: van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 9, N 30)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 59, no. 9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1421) (phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2941 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
